alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 8:52AM MDT until June 19 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. This includes the city of Casper and surrounding suburbs. Creeks and streams coming down from Casper Mountain are running high and fast. * WHEN...Until 100 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Standing water on roadways. Ponding of water in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 AM MDT, Doppler radar continued to show moderate rain over the region. This will likely continue to lead to urban and small stream flooding through the early afternoon. Gauges and radar estimate between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past 24 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area, which may lead to additional ponding of water and minor flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Soda Lake Draw, Sixmile Draw, West Fork Garden Creek, Garden Creek, North Platte River, Casper Creek, Dry Muddy Creek, Elkhorn Creek, Thorndale Acres Draw, East Fork Elkhorn Creek and Wolf Creek. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Casper, Mills, Evansville, Red Butte, Paradise Valley, Casper Natural Gas Processing Plant, Fort Caspar Campground, Central Wyoming Fairgrounds and Casper Events Center.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
